content.title: Failsafe tail
descr: Extracting the tail from a linked list is as simple as T(KI).
However, applying it to an already empty list will lead to alternating
Instead, create an idempotent tail function that returns
the second element of a pair when given a pair, and an empty list given an empty list.
That is tail (V a b) = b, and tail (KI) = KI.

content.title: Fold
descr: Implement fold: fold [a, b, ... z] f x = f a (f b (... (f z x) ...)).
More specifically, fold nil f x = x
and fold (V a b) f x = f a (fold b f x).
Note that is you reuse lst and nil from the previous chapter,
you could care less about what f and x are.
